Reviews.Title: Description is a lie
Reviews.Author: Disappointed
Reviews.Content: I've never written a negative review for either amazon or ebay, but this deserves it. The description clearly states this phone is UNLOCKED. It is not. It is locked and you need to purchase an unlock code to use the phone. To describe the phone as unlocked and then list at&t; and t-mobile as carriers this phone will automatically work with is a flat LIE. Amazon should not let OEM shop sell this with that description.

Reviews.Title: DON'T BUY, IT IS NOT UNLOCKED!!!  Didn't work with T-Mobile, even though it said it would in the ad!
Reviews.Author: BB703
Reviews.Content: If you read the ad for this item, it says in both the headline and description that it is "Unlocked".  Then if you read on, it says that it is unlocked and will work with AT&T; and T-Mobile.  I figured this was the perfect solution, since I wanted an Android phone, to ride out the remaining 4 months on my T-Mobile contract.  The phone arrived, i put in my sim card, put in the battery, turned it on, and immediately it said "Network Locked" on the screen.  This means the phone is not "Unlocked" as advertised, and requires an unlock code to be purchased from a website.  Those codes ranged anywhere from $25-40 on the sites I checked.  Then after you purchase the code, most sites take an additional 36-48 hours to email you the code.  If the phone is advertised as unlocked, you shouldn't have to pay an additional cost just to make it work with a carrier listed as ok for this phone.  In fact, this is a definite euro phone.  The charger for the phone as a euro end on it, which has to be plugged into a US converter, and then into the wall.  Again, just annoying.  Don't waste your time or money on this phone, it will just irritate you.  I sent mine back within an hour of getting it from UPS.  Spend the extra 25-40 bucks it will cost you to unlock it, and get a better phone.  I'd give this negative stars if it would let me.  Thumbs down.

Reviews.Title: Smart enough
Reviews.Author: Darrel Reese
Reviews.Content: PROS:The phone does everything desired: Unlocked, quad band, wi-fi, bluetooth, 3G, syncs with google, takes photos, plays music, videos, games...etc. I bought it mainly for using SIMs for prepaid accounts both in US and abroad, and a bit of surfing/emailing when wi-fi is available.CONS:Screen contrast is hard to see outside, but I haven't looked to see if there is a setting for that. Not a deal breaker.Unfortunately, it's LG and difficult to get an update to Android 2.1 while in States, so 1.6 will have to do for most of us....LG has yet to work out all the red-tape kinks, and the phone isn't technically supported in USA. So US residents will have a hard time figuring out how to use the USB cable for anything other than charging, like getting a PC computer to communicate with the SD card (Maybe Linux and Apple users are having an easier time with it?) And it didn't come with a CD or even link to download software for syncing it to your computer...If only LG would realize that their products are being sold in US and lobby a bit harder for allowing full support, regardless of the networks and software developers...Also, because it's only OS 1.6 (Donut), you aren't permitted to use the SD card for executable apps (i.e. expand your phones internal memory), and can only use it for storage and playback, and file/app backups.Note that I've quickly discovered that an internal 200 MB doesn't get you very far...but that was my shortsightedness -- I hadn't planned on overloading it with apps.RECOMMENDATION? The phone itself works great. However, some of the smart device tasks that should be easy (OS updating, accessing SD card, transferring files to and from) might be a bit challenging for most, especially if live LG support is missing. I'd suggest going to the LG website first and seeing if you can select the model in your country's list of available/supported phones...if so, chances are you'll have access to all the tools and fewer problems. If it isn't, then I suggest finding a model that is supported.

Reviews.Title: Good but it lags....
Reviews.Author: Kensmoke
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone cause I wanted to get into both the Android and the smart phones world, and this phone fullfils..... It its unlocked that means you can use it with any carrier, I just got it slip the sim in and it wordked right away. Started making configurations, all easy and quick. There are thousands of apps for it. Downloading them is easy and fast. Wi fi is incredible, it reaches real far and connections are fast and easy as well. Configurations for Gmail and Yahoo, simple. Notifications when receiving mails in yahoo and Gmail, perfect. There is not any good app for hotmail mail config and/or notifications. VPN mail good. Attachmentas are a problem though with VPN mail. Call conections: great so far. I've been using it for a month now.Reception, great. The reason why I give it 4 stars is cause the loudspeaker is not that good, neither for calls nor for music o media player in general. But its biggest problems is that it lags when you are using the contact list.Mails: fast. Internet connection: Fast. Galery view: fast. Contact list: very slow.... you wnat to reach a contact and you have to wait for the processor to open the whole list. Once it's displayed it's ok, but it is very slow in acquiring that information. Sometimes it is even necessary to restart it to get it to work faster. Hopefully that problem was solved by LG for its other Optimus phone.Apart from that, it is a good purchase. If you don't mind that situation, I would recommend to buy it, for getting into the Android and Smartphones world.

Reviews.Title: Excellent phone
Reviews.Author: Manda Jane
Reviews.Content: Do you want a new flashy phone? This is not it.If you want a practical affordable phone that isn't so basic that you want to cry, then this is the product for you.It is unlocked so you can do what you want with it. It's international so you can use it when you travel and all you need is a local sim card, or roaming on your local card.I have upgraded mine to the most recent official android update (2.1) which is not 4.0 but it's good enough. I do everything on mine from browsing the net, to android apps for chat (nimbuzz, skype) and mail checks - very proficient phone.The only thing is if you are used to iphone or more expensive phones the touch screen reactivity might bother you. This isn't the most expensive type of touch screen it is only so so. Therefore, it requires some patience on your part. I kept trying to pinch zoom and you can't do that on this phone! (Spoilt by my other half's iphone).I have had it for a year and a half and use it every day. The charge is still good for almost a week with minimal use (a few texts and calls in the week). If you use it heavily (like, almost all day checking mail and chatting) the charge might only last you one day but that's pretty normal.All you need is a TPU case from ebay and you will be set.

Reviews.Title: Product IS unlocked, IS in English, and DOES upgrade
Reviews.Author: Zutroy
Reviews.Content: To whoever has been complaining about this product in the past, whichever vendor that was dishonest is no longer associated with this particular page.  The phone I bought was shipped by 'Best N Price' and adhered exactly to the description.I was able to slip my SIM card right into the phone, it charged right up, and it functioned properly. So, to be clear, it's fully unlocked and working on the AT&T; network as I type. On Android, I was able to upgrade the OS to 2.1 without much trouble -- the updater did the thing where it stops at 4%, which happens with LG phones sometimes, but I was able to restart it without wrecking the phone. The phone is unquestionably durable as well, because I dropped it onto a wood floor the second day I had it and it didn't break. There was no data loss or cracked screen, and the phone worked like normal when I powered it back on.When you're buying this phone, bear a few things in mind; It's a European phone, so it's probably not going to give you a 3G signal -- and, according to some, it may arrive in a Continental language (although I received a UK version). It's also a couple years old, so it's going to have Android 1.6, and the hardware isn't going to be able to handle more than 2.1. Another reviewer here listed the steps to upgrade it to 2.3, but I'm not risking turning it into a paperweight.All in all, you're getting what you pay for with an Android phone in this price range. It was $89.99 when I ordered it, but it looks like the price has shot up. In any case, it's a great deal for that price, but you have no business expecting it to be as capable as a brand new Galaxy or something. In addition, it's a foreign model like many other unlocked phones being sold online, so you ought to be prepared for that eventuality and understand that's part of the reason it's inexpensive.One more thing: have a microSDHC card for the phone, preferably Class 4. It takes up to 32GB (and not microSDXC; too new), and the memory card is needed for many features like downloads and pictures because the phone has very little internal memory. Almost everybody has a microSD card lying around, but be prepared if you don't -- or have a Class 2, since that'll probably be too slow -- because there are plenty of good deals for the high capacity Class 4s on this site.

Reviews.Title: Good phone and upgradable to Gingerbread 2.3.7, BUT...don't buy from Wireless Experts. They are gouging scumbags.
Reviews.Author: A. Koziol
Reviews.Content: Hi. I have a review from Sept. 16th on the other GT540 seller link that details step by step how to upgrade this phone to Gingerbread 2.3.7. It's helped out a few people. But I would like to inform all others who are about to buy this phone to not buy it from Wireless Experts. Mid-September, I bought this phone for $119 + shipping. Shortly after, I wrote a review on how to upgrade this phone to Gingerbread 2.3.7 and after my guide/review on how to update it, it went from $119 to $150, to $199, and now it's $249. That is INSANE and I want the seller (Wireless Experts) who is gouging on this phone to stop as it is unethical. You can buy this phone unlocked elsewhere but I ask you boycott Wireless Experts for gouging on this phone. For $250, you can get a better phone than the GT540. I want this seller (Wireless Experts) to know they are scumbags for doing this. You can get this phone elsewhere (ahem...a certain auction site). Thanks.By the way, I am on AT&T; and this phone works fine for me but it doesn't support 3G if that matters to you. AT&T;'s band is 1900. I popped in my SIM card and AT&T; came right up without fuss. I don't use a data plan and that's why I bought this phone, so I could use WiFi for free. Other T-Mobile people have had success with this phone too. Read all the T-Mobile reviews for this model (Titanium Silver, 26+ reviews) and the Black model with 85+ reviews.UPDATE: Wow, no more than a few days after posting this, the phone has *magically* dropped back down to $139.If you want to MOD you phone to run Gingerbread 2.3.7, use my guide below. It's FREE, and unlike Wireless Experts, I won't gouge you for it.(For Windows XP, Windows Vista, Windows 7)I did this procedure to my unlocked GT540 with Android 2.1-update1. There is no undo button. Once you mod (update) up your phone, you can't go back. Trust me, you won't want to. It is best to do this on a new phone as you will lose *all* your stuff (pics, vids, numbers, texts, etc). Back up your phone numbers or installed apps if you have a backup program. Do not restore default apps from Android 2.1 to Android 2.3 or you'll screw up your apps / phone and have to redo the mod process. Just reinstall the apps you had from scratch.Let's begin:-Make sure USB DEBUGGING MODE is turned ON. Go to Settings > Applications > Development and turn on USB Debugging Mode.-Make sure MASS STORAGE mode is turned OFF. Go to Settings > SD Card & Phone Storage and turn OFF Mass Storage Mode.1. Do a search for "KDZ Updater Europe Open", you'll likely get a link to it on Mediafire. It's a 144.87MB file. Download it.2. Do a search for the file: Android237GT540_02-Nov-ENG.exe (or Android237GT540_06-OctoberENG.exe if you can't find Android237GT540_02-Nov-ENG.exe). You'll likely get a link to it on FileServe. It's a 107.69MB file. Download it.3. Do a search for FastbootDrivers_LG_GT540.zip, you'll likely get a link to it on Mediafire. It's a 1.33MB file. You may or may not need these but download it all the same.4. After getting the above three files, unzip KDZ Updater Europe Open.zip and FastbootDrivers_LG_GT540.zip to a folder.5. In the KDZ Updater Europe Open folder, make sure there are 4 files: 1) Europe Open+Fastboot.kdz, 2) LGAndroidDriver_WHQL_ML_Ver_1.0_All_Win7.exe, 3) msxml.msi, 4) z4root.1.3.0.apk.6. Install the phone drivers: LGAndroidDriver_WHQL_ML_Ver_1.0_All_Win7.exe. If it asks you to reboot, reboot.7. If you don't have the Microsoft XML 4.0 SP3 Parser (check your Add / Remove Programs for MSXML 4.0 SP3 Parser), install msxml.msi.8. Install and use the z4root tool to your phone to *permanently* root your phone. It will run, do a song and dance, and reboot your phone if successful.9. Although the update did not mess with my microSD card, you can unmount (Settings > Phone and SD Storage > Unmount SD) and take out your microSD card if you want.10. Power off your phone, take out the battery, put the battery back in.11. With the phone powered OFF, hold down the Volume Down button and press and hold down the Power button.12. You should see Download Mode appear on the screen. If not, repeat step 12.13. Plug in the USB cable to the side of the phone and plug the other end of the USB cable to your computer. Windows will find the phone and install the drivers and it should *not* complain about "unable to install drivers." It may ask you to reboot. If so, reboot. Leave the phone in Download Mode.14. In the KDZ Updater Europe Open folder, find KDZ_FW_UPD.exe and run it.15. Set Type to "3GQCT" and Phone Mode to "DIAG."16. For KDZ file, choose Europe Open+Fastboot.kdz from the KDZ Updater Europe Open folder.17. Click Launch Software Update. It should take roughly 5 minutes to complete if you are using USB 2.0 speed. It will reboot your phone automatically (the Download Mode screen will disappear).18. Be ready to do the following step quickly: When you phone reboots, hold down the Camera button until the LG logo disappears and the screen is black and nothing further continues to happen. You are now in what is called Fastboot Mode. If you were too slow and the phone is booting up, pull the battery out, unplug the USB cable from your computer, put the battery back in and try again by holding down the Camera button and pressing the Power button until the LG logo disappears. Plug the USB cable back into your computer.19. Windows may now say it found a new ADB Device (or some similar thing) and needs the driver. If so, point it to the folder where you unzipped the FastbootDrivers_LG_GT540 files. If not, proceed to the next step.20. Find Android237GT540_02-Nov-ENG.exe (or Android237GT540_06-OctoberENG.exe if you can't find Android237GT540_02-Nov-ENG.exe) and run it. Read the directions and info (slightly broken English). It will unzip all the Gingerbread update files to a folder called C:\GT540. Since you have Android 2.1, you will be choosing to do an INSTALL, *NOT* an Update.21. Once you click INSTALL, you will see a DOS command window open (the instructions tell you this) and this is where the magic is happening. After about 5 minutes, it will complete and close and your phone should reboot. Do not stop the INSTALL process or you might brick your phone in which case you start all over again.22. After reboot, it will take around 5 minutes for Gingerbread to rebuild itself on the phone and load up. Unplug the USB cable from the phone. You'll see LG GT540  SwiftDroid appear and then a blue Android on a skateboard zoom by and then a blue Android screen with a spinning arrow with the words Cyanogen Mod 7. If you see that, you are good to go. Just wait patiently until it finishes loading everything. Have fun! Also, please sign the petition to get the Cyanogen team to work on the GT540. Google the phrase "LG GT540 Official Cyanogenmod Support Petition" and also donate to the CyanogenMod / SwiftDroid team as they make this all possible. Make sure you let them know it was a GT540!Note: One of the nice benefits of the SwiftDroid / Cyanogen mod is the ability to overclock your CPU. However, many forums out there warn to NOT go past 800MHz as you are almost guaranteed to have issues. Mine is running happily at 672MHz. By default, it underclocks your CPU to 245Mhz when idle to save battery power. Drop down to 122Mhz to save even more battery! Settings > CyanogenMod Settings > Performance > CPU Settings > Min CPU Frequency.

Reviews.Title: Very nice phone
Reviews.Author: Tony Manso
Reviews.Content: This is my first android phone and I must say I am not disappointed in the least. As a phone it works great. Great quality sound and strong phone connections. But as a PDA, this thing can almost replace my laptop as a personal computing device. The CPU performance is more than adequate and the graphics quality is unbelievable especially considering the small physical size of this phone. The WI-FI, bluetooth and GPS all work beautifully as well. Unfortunately, I can't say anything about the 3G/4G capability as I only use the WI-FI for internet access.Pros:+ Small footprint. Fits nicely in small pockets.+ Fast processor makes for very responsive user interface.+ Great phone and PDA. I have seen several smartphones that are good as one but not the other.Cons:+ Small screen makes keyboard entry very difficult in portrait mode. Landscape mode keyboard input is much more tolerable. Also, there are "replacement" keyboards the use predictive analysis to compensate for "fat fingering".+ Only runs Android 1.6. Despite numerous web sites that claim it can be upgraded to 2.0, all my efforts to upgrade the phone failed miserably.Unknown:+ 3G or 4G performance. Comments welcome.Summary:Overall, I say this phone rocks as long as you don't mind using Android 1.6.

Reviews.Title: Unsupported
Reviews.Author: George Kirkman
Reviews.Content: When this phone arrived, I charged the battery, and put in my SIMS card, The dial-tone worked, the texting work, WiFi worked. I even downloaded and installed some apps via WiFi. I then had a question and I called LG's US support number and was told they only support LG phones made for the  US market. Later on I took it to the AT&T; store for a data package. When the clerk tried to setup the data package, he couldn't get it to work.  Next he called their tech support line and  was told AT&T; does not support non-AT&T; phones. The clerk then removed the data package from my billSo if you have AT&T; and plan on using this phone as a smartphone, forget it.
